title: Epic: Mitigate AI bot crawling attack on /profile routes
description: GPTBot/1.3 made 2,385 requests in 15 minutes on Feb 10, consuming 1,060s of serverless compute and 1,817 function invocations. It crawled /profile/[address] with invalid inputs like 'kiriba group', 'god', 'me' instead of Ethereum addresses, triggering 243 server errors. Need multi-layer defense: robots.txt (advisory), Edge middleware (enforcement + validation), and in-route validation (defense in depth).
close_reason: Completed: All three mitigation layers deployed in 12f2ee7

title: Add Vercel Edge middleware for bot blocking + address validation
description: Create middleware.ts at project root. Runs on Vercel Edge Runtime (near-zero cost, no serverless invocations). Two layers: (1) Check User-Agent header against BLOCKED_BOTS array and return 403 for matches (2) For /profile/* routes, validate address parameter with regex /^0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40}$/ and return 404 for non-Ethereum addresses before hitting serverless functions. Matcher covers all routes except static assets (_next/static, images, robots.txt). Acceptance: Invalid profile URLs like /profile/god return 404 at edge with zero function invocations.
close_reason: Completed: 12f2ee7 - Created middleware.ts with bot blocking and address validation at edge

title: Add early address validation in profile route
description: Add defense-in-depth validation to app/profile/[address]/page.tsx. After awaiting params, add regex check for valid Ethereum address format (/^0x[a-fA-F0-9]{40}$/) and call notFound() immediately if invalid. Wrap getAddress() call in try/catch as safety net for checksummed-invalid addresses. Import notFound from 'next/navigation'. Ensures import order follows biome conventions. Acceptance: Invalid addresses return 404 before any GraphQL queries or currency conversions execute.
close_reason: Completed: 12f2ee7 - Added early address validation with notFound() in profile route
